column5: This has been going on in my backyard for about 2 hours now.  I have searched the whole neighbourhood and it is definately in my backyard, but it is too dark to see anything.  Is is a frog or bug.  Has anyone ever heard this before.  It is so loud!

Welcome to the American Toad!  Cheers, Ron... Call: The call is a monotone trill up to 30 seconds long, preceded by a single, slightly lower introductory note. In a breeding chorus each male selects a different note to call on.   http://www.naturewatch.ca/english/frogwatch/species_details.asp?species=0
Wow, really Ron.  Never heard one that loud in my life!!!  Thanks!
Spring peepers!!  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spring_peeper

Yes spring peepers !!!!! We have tons of them where I live !!!!!! They sure make a racket !!!!!! There is a big farm pond about 1/8 mile from my house and they have been at it for about 2 weeks now !!!!!! Every spring I love it!!!! Have to dodge them on the road every morning on the way to work !!!!! Lol
Ron has it right...it's an American Toad.   Spring Peepers' calls are much shorter.
yes we have just always called them that since we were kids sorry...its like the pickeral,walleye thing !!!! lol....

Well I just find it weird I've lived in Ontario most of my life, born and raised, moved a few times in and around Ontario, and I have never heard anything this loud.  I actually thought it was someone's house alarm going off at first.  Sure was neat and after awhile, it lulled me to sleep
Yup, I have a friend in Waterloo with a pond in his backyard, he gets thousands every year lol

I open my pool early every year just to keep them ouut of it. It gets really loud when you get a bunch of them, and spring peepers all together!  Right now I have this dumb woodpecker who keeps pecking on my sat dish. Its like a gong going off every morning at 445am! I'd rather have the toads and peepers! Even my neighbours are complaining lol  S.
Sounds like an alien calling the mother ship for pick up. Any little green fellas in the yard Joey.
Maybe it is Roy's mating call...
Metalic brake pads? HH
LOL, it really is an eerie sound eh!
Hahahaha, yup, pop out my nose, thanks Beans!
I thought maybe it was the steam blowing out of Pauls ears,trying to remember laker way points. HAHAHAHAHA  Never heard that before either J. Really cool.
Hahahaha, maybe that was it B  p.s.  Will let you know about Sunday by tomorrow night K
Cant wait to slam some lakers with friends.
That dumb woodpecker must leave your place and arrive at my place by 6:50 am. Driving me nuts with his rapping on the steel guard on the telephone pole.  Six mornings straight so far.     LOL
Well he's back again tonight, and he brought friends this time  Guess I'd better start enjoying the noise and hopefully it will lull me to sleep
